column4: Illinois  Iowa  Rhode Island urge rejection of Sinclair-Tribune tie-up
column5: WASHINGTON The attorneys general of Illinois  Iowa and Rhode Island urged the Federal Communications Commission to reject Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc’s proposed $3.9 billion acquisition of Tribune Media Co  citing "excessive consolidation" in the television market

column4: Starbucks blames slower China growth on drop in third-party delivery orders
column5: Starbucks Corp  has reported a sudden slowdown in China growth just weeks after trumpeting rapid expansion in the country  citing a drop-off in unapproved third-party delivery services whose bulk orders had been clogging up its cafes. | Video

column4: UPDATE 3-Starbucks blames slower China growth on drop in third-party delivery orders
column5: * Drop in third-party delivery services which place bulk orders

column4: UPDATE 1-Deutsche Telekom's T-Systems to cut 10 000 jobs - CEO
column5: * Verdi union slams "savings programme without ideas" (Adds original sourcing  context)

column4: AT&T to launch wireless plans bundled with video after Time Warner win
column5: AT&T Inc  will launch two new unlimited wireless plans next week that will be bundled with a new video streaming service called WatchTV  in the company's first move to pair entertainment with phone service after closing its $85 billion acquisition of media company Time Warner Inc.

column4: Carlyle raises $6.55 billion for new Asia fund
column5: HONG KONG Carlyle Group  said on Thursday it had raised $6.55 billion for its Asia private equity fund  its biggest ever  which will seek buyout and strategic investment opportunities across a wide range of sectors in the region.

column4: Linde  Praxair offer concessions in bid to win EU okay for merger
column5: BRUSSELS  June 21 German industrial gases company Linde and U.S. peer Praxair have offered concessions in a bid to address EU antitrust concerns and secure approval for their merger.

column4: Taiwan's TSMC to invest $25 billion in 5 nanometer node technology
column5: HSINCHU  Taiwan Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd  a supplier to Apple Inc  said on Thursday it expects to invest $25 billion in 5 nanometer node technology.

column5: HSINCHU  Taiwan  June 21 Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co Ltd  a supplier to Apple Inc   said on Thursday it expects to invest $25 billion in 5 nanometer node technology.

column4: Israel's UroGen to start mid-stage bladder cancer trial
column5: RAANANA  Israel Israel's UroGen Pharma plans to begin a mid-stage trial of its treatment for bladder cancer patients in August  after positive interim results last month from an advanced trial of a treatment for upper urinary tract cancer.

column4: INTERVIEW-Israel's UroGen to start mid-stage bladder cancer trial
column5: RAANANA  Israel  June 21 Israel's UroGen Pharma plans to begin a mid-stage trial of its treatment for bladder cancer patients in August  after positive interim results last month from an advanced trial of a treatment for upper urinary tract cancer.

column4: Siris Capital unit to buy Web.com for $2 billion
column5: Web.com Group Inc  a provider of internet domain name registration services  said on Thursday an affiliate of private equity firm Siris Capital would buy the company for about $2 billion in cash.

column4: Sorrell hits out at WPP over handling of his sudden departure
column5: CANNES  France  June 21 Martin Sorrell  the recently deposed founder of advertising giant WPP  hit out over his treatment from the board of the British company on Thursday at his first major public appearance since he quit in April.

column4: Online retailers slide after U.S. court ruling on sales tax
column5: ** Shares of online retailers take a hit after U.S. Supreme Court allows states to force these companies to collect sales tax
